metrics.name: Automation Rate Over Events
metrics.signalFragment:
count(event_name) FILTER 
(WHERE "Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')) 
/ count(event_name) * 100

blocks.text: This Dashboard shows the level of automation in the standard procure-to-pay process. This breakdown can be used to identify automation potential in your process.
Structure of the Dashboard
Page 1 - Overview: Leading KPIs, a Process Discovery Widget and a Total Cost Estimation of Manual PO Item Creation
Page 2 - Deep Dive: Overview of automated vs manual events in the current data set, Automation Recommender, Automation by Plant, RPA Bots and Company
Page 3 - Case Data: Overview of all individual Case Details
Page 4 - Actions: offers a summary of different recommendations based on the degree of automation
Please see our Dashboard Documentation for more information on how to manage your dashboards.

If you feel our Dashboards helped you during your analysis, please share some feedback regarding improvement ideas, wishes, and problems. We always try to improve and extend the Dashboard Templates to provide you with the best experience possible. You can submit your feedback here.

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM((SELECT COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service') 
        ))
	))
	/ SUM((SELECT COUNT(event_name)))* 100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Number of Automation Events Over Time

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	DATE_TRUNC('MONTH', (SELECT LAST (END_TIME) FILTER (
    	WHERE EVENT_NAME IN ('Create PO Item')))) AS "PO Creation Date", 
	SUM((SELECT COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service'))))) AS "Number of automated events"
FROM THIS_PROCESS
WHERE EVENT_NAME MATCHES ('Create PO Item')
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL TIMESERIES('MONTH'), NULL

children.name: Ø Automation Rate of Contracting Events
children.description: Automation Rate of Contracting events like 'Create Contract' and 'Change Contract'

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Contract Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        	AND (event_name LIKE '%Contract%'
		)))
	))
	/ SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Contract Id") FILTER (
		WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%Contract%'))) * 100
        
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Ø Automation Rate of PO Events
children.description: Automation Rate of Purchase Order (PO) events like 'Create PO', 'Change PO' and 'Confirm Order'

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM((SELECT COUNT("PO Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        	AND (event_name LIKE '%PO%'
        		OR event_name LIKE '%Purchase Order%'
        		OR event_name LIKE '%Order Confirmation%'
        )))
	))
	/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("PO Id") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%PO%'
        	OR event_name LIKE '%Purchase Order%'
        	OR event_name LIKE '%Order Confirmation%'
    ))) * 100
        
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Ø Automation Rate of PR Events
children.description: Automation Rate for Purchase Requisition (PR)  events like 'PR Creation' and 'PR Changes'

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM((SELECT COUNT("First PR Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        	AND (event_name LIKE '%PR%'
        )))
	))
	/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("First PR Id") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%PR%')))	* 100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Ø Automation Rate of GI/GR Events
children.description: Automation Rate of Goods Receipt events like 'Create GR', 'Shipment Notice' and 'Quality Inspections'

dataSource.query:
SELECT
    SUM((SELECT COUNT("Last GR Doc. ID") FILTER (
            WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
            AND (event_name LIKE '%Shipment Notice%'
              OR event_name LIKE '%GR%'
              OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Receipt%'
              OR event_name LIKE '%GI%'
              OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Issue%'
              OR event_name LIKE '%Make Quality Usage Decision%'             
            )))
        ))
    / SUM((SELECT COUNT("Last GR Doc. ID") FILTER (
        WHERE event_name LIKE '%Shipment Notice%'
            OR event_name LIKE '%GR%'
            OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Receipt%'
            OR event_name LIKE '%GI%'
            OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Issue%'
            OR event_name LIKE '%Make Quality Usage Decision%'
	))) * 100
    
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Ø Automation Rate of Invoice Events
children.description: Automation Rate of Invoice events like 'Create Invoice', 'Clear Invoice'

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	SUM((SELECT COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
    	    AND (event_name LIKE '%Invoice%'
        	OR event_name LIKE '%Payment%'
        )))
	))
	/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%Invoice%'
        	OR event_name LIKE '%Payment%'
	))) * 100
    
FROM THIS_PROCESS

SELECT
	SUM((SELECT COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service') 
        ))
	))
	/ SUM((SELECT COUNT(event_name)))* 100
FROM THIS_PROCESS

children.name: Automation rate by Company Code
children.description: Automation rate by Company Code - Top 20

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	SUM((SELECT COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
    	WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service'))))) 
	/ SUM ((SELECT COUNT (EVENT_NAME))) * 100 AS "Automation rate in %",
    "PO Company Name" AS "Company"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 DESC NULLS LAST 
LIMIT 20

children.name: Automation Recommender
children.description: This table shows the most frequent transitions between events or states. This highlights flows of events, that are interesting Automation Use Cases when there is a high average Lead Time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	Event_Name AS "Event Name", 
    "Following event",
    COUNT(Event_Name) AS "Occurence",
    COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    	WHERE "Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service'))
    / COUNT("event_name") * 100 AS "Automation Rate in %",
    
    AVG(Event_Cycle_Time) AS "AVG Lead Time",
    MIN(Event_Cycle_Time) AS "MIN Lead Time",
    MAX(Event_Cycle_Time) AS "MAX Lead Time"
    
FROM (
	SELECT
    	Event_Name,
        LEAD(Event_Name) OVER () AS "Following event",
        LEAD(End_Time) OVER (PARTITION BY Case_Id) - End_Time AS Event_Cycle_Time,
        "Event Created By User Type"
	FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS) 
) AS sub_query_Event_Cycle_Time

WHERE Event_Cycle_Time IS NOT NULL 
GROUP BY 1, 2
ORDER BY 3 DESC,1 ASC

children.name: Number of automated vs manual events sorted by event frequency

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	COUNT(event_name) as "Cases",
    "event_name" AS "Event Name",
    CASE 
		WHEN "Event Created By User Type" = 'Dialog' THEN 'Manual'
		WHEN "Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service') THEN 'Automated'
		ELSE 'undefined' 
	END AS "Automation"

FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)
GROUP BY 2,3
ORDER BY 1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT 20

SELECT 
	COUNT(event_name)
    
FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)

SELECT
	event_name AS "Event Name",
    COUNT(case_id) AS "# of PO Items",
    COUNT(event_name) AS "# of Events",
    
    COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
		WHERE "Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service'))
	/ COUNT("event_name") * 100 AS "Automation Rate in %"

FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS )
ORDER BY 3 desc

children.name: Most active RPA Bots/ Automation Users
children.description: Definition: the frequency of events and POs of non dialogue users ist shown here. It is recommended to map RPA user to their official name instead of pseudonymising their names

dataSource.query:
SELECT 
	"Event Created By User Id",
    event_name AS "Event Name",
	COUNT(case_id) AS "# of PO Items",
    COUNT(event_name) AS "# of Events",
    COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
    	WHERE "Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service'))
	/ COUNT("event_name") * 100 AS "Automation Rate in %"

FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS )
WHERE "Event Created By User Type" != 'Dialog'
ORDER BY 4 desc

SELECT 
	SUM ((SELECT COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
    	WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service'))))) 
	/ SUM ((SELECT COUNT (EVENT_NAME))) * 100 AS "Automation rate in %",
    "PO Item Plant" AS "Plant"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT 20

children.name: Number of Automated Events by Company over time

dataSource.query:
SELECT
	DATE_TRUNC('month', (SELECT FIRST (end_time))) AS "Month",
    SUM ((SELECT COUNT (EVENT_NAME) FILTER (
    	WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System', 'Service'))))) AS "Automated Events"
	,"PO Company Name" AS "Company"

FROM THIS_PROCESS
ORDER BY 1 ASC NULLS FIRST
FILL timeseries('MONTH'), NULL

SELECT 
	COUNT(event_name) FILTER(
    	WHERE("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')))
        
FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS)

SELECT
	CASE 
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%PO%' OR event_name LIKE '%Purchase Order%' OR event_name LIKE '%Order Confirmation%' THEN 'PO events'
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%Invoice%' OR event_name LIKE '%Payment%' THEN 'Invoice events'
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%PR%' THEN 'PR events'
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%Contract%' THEN 'Contract events'
    WHEN event_name LIKE '%GR%' OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Receipt%'
      OR event_name LIKE '%GI%' OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Issue%'
      OR event_name LIKE '%Shipment Notice%' OR event_name LIKE '%Make Quality Usage Decision%'
    	THEN 'GI/GR events'
    ELSE event_name
    END AS "Group of Events",
    COUNT(case_id) AS "# of PO Items",
    COUNT(event_name) AS "# of Events",
    
    COUNT(event_name) FILTER (
		WHERE "Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service'))
	/ COUNT("event_name") * 100 AS "Automation Rate in %"

FROM FLATTEN(THIS_PROCESS )
ORDER BY 3 desc

blocks.text: PRs:

Automate your Purchase Requisition Approval and Release: SAP ERP Purchase Requisition Approval at the Line Item level including validation and release using SAP Build Process Automation or SAP Workflow Management.
Intelligent Processing of Invoices without Purchase Orders:  Leverage Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning capabilities to Manage Invoices without Purchase Orders.

Manage Invoices without Purchase Order:  Manage the posting of Invoices without Purchase Orders into SAP ERP with validations and additional approvals using SAP Workflow Management or SAP Build Process Automation.

SAP Build Process Automation Integration with SAP ERP for Purchase Order: This package contains integration flows to create Purchase Orders in SAP ERP from the live process content Manage Purchase Order Approval and Creation.
POs:
Automation Execution: Discover and run automation, and get information about automation runs.
Purchase Order Confirmations: Automatically performs the Purchase Order Confirmations in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

Procure to Order: The content package includes Purchase Requisition Approval, Release, and Purchase Order creation. This includes Purchase Requisition approvals at the Items level, Header level, and Purchase Order creation.
Visibility on Procure to Pay: Gain real-time process visibility and insight-to-action in your procurement operations.
Create Purchase Requisitions from Excel: Enables mass creation of Purchase Requisitions in SAP S/4HANA systems based on an Excel input template.
Invoice:

Manage Purchase Order Approval and Creation: Automate and manage the approvals and creation of Purchase Orders in SAP ERP with approvals performed in SAP Workflow Management or SAP Build Process Automation.
Manage Customer Refund Request: Enables automating Customer Refund Request in a flexible and transparent way using automatic/manual decisions in SAP SAP S/4HANA.

children.name: Recommendations for action based on sub-process events and their rates of automation

dataSource.query:
SELECT
-- Contracting
CASE
	WHEN(SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Contract Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%Contract%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Contract Id") FILTER (
		WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%Contract%')))) 
    >= 0.7 
	THEN 'Automation rate is above 70%. No action needed.'
	WHEN (SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Contract Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%Contract%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Contract Id") FILTER (
		WHERE "event_name" LIKE '%Contract%'))))
    >= 0.4
	THEN 'Automation rate is between 30% and 70%. Potential for improvement.'
	ELSE 'Automation rate is below 30%. Improvement highly recommended.'
END AS "Contracting",



-- Purchase Requisition
CASE
	WHEN (SUM((SELECT COUNT("First PR Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%PR%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("First PR Id") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%PR%'))))
    >= 0.7 
	THEN 'Automation rate is above 70%. No action needed.'
	WHEN (SUM((SELECT COUNT("First PR Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%PR%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("First PR Id") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%PR%'))))
    >= 0.3
	THEN 'Automation rate is between 30% and 70%. Potential for improvement.'
	ELSE 'Automation rate is below 30%. Improvement highly recommended.'
END AS "Purchase Requisition",



-- Purchase Order
CASE
	WHEN(
		SUM((SELECT COUNT("PO Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%PO%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Purchase Order%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Order Confirmation%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("PO Id") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%PO%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Purchase Order%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Order Confirmation%'
        ))))
    >= 0.7 
	THEN 'Automation rate is above 70%. No action needed.'
	WHEN (SUM((SELECT COUNT("PO Id") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%PO%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Purchase Order%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Order Confirmation%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("PO Id") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%PO%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Purchase Order%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Order Confirmation%'
        ))))
    >= 0.3
	THEN 'Automation rate is between 30% and 70%. Potential for improvement.'
	ELSE 'Automation rate is below 30%. Improvement highly recommended.'
END AS "Purchase Order",



-- Goods Receipt Doc.
CASE
	WHEN(
		SUM((SELECT COUNT("Last GR Doc. ID") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%Shipment Notice%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%GR%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Receipt%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Make Quality Usage Decision%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("Last GR Doc. ID") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%Shipment Notice%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%GR%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Receipt%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Make Quality Usage Decision%'
        ))))
	    >= 0.7 
	THEN 'Automation rate is above 70%. No action needed.'
	WHEN (SUM((SELECT COUNT("Last GR Doc. ID") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%Shipment Notice%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%GR%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Receipt%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Make Quality Usage Decision%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT("Last GR Doc. ID") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%Shipment Notice%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%GR%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Goods Receipt%'
        OR event_name LIKE '%Make Quality Usage Decision%'
        ))))
    >= 0.3
	THEN 'Automation rate is between 30% and 70%. Potential for improvement.'
	ELSE 'Automation rate is below 30%. Improvement highly recommended.'
END AS "Goods Receipt",



-- FI Invoice
CASE
	WHEN(
		SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%Invoice%'
        	OR event_name LIKE '%Payment%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%Invoice%'
        	OR event_name LIKE '%Payment%'))))
    >= 0.7 
	THEN 'Automation rate is above 70%. No action needed.'
	WHEN (SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (
		WHERE ("Event Created By User Type" IN ('System','Service')
        AND (event_name LIKE '%Invoice%'
        	OR event_name LIKE '%Payment%'
        )))))
		/ SUM((SELECT COUNT(Distinct "Last FI Invoice ID") FILTER (
		WHERE event_name LIKE '%Invoice%'
        	OR event_name LIKE '%Payment%'))))
    >= 0.3
	THEN 'Automation rate is between 30% and 70%. Potential for improvement.'
	ELSE 'Automation rate is below 30%. Improvement highly recommended.'
END AS "Invoice"

FROM THIS_PROCESS

SELECT
 case_id AS "PO Number"
,"PO Vendor Name"
,"PO Vendor Number"
,"PO Category"
,"PO Company Code"
,"PO Company Name"
,"PO Type"

-- aggregated KPIs
,AVG((SELECT LAST(END_TIME)) - (SELECT FIRST(END_TIME))) AS "Total Cycle Time"

FROM "THIS_PROCESS"
ORDER BY 1 DESC NULLS LAST
LIMIT 500
